document_data.caption: ''Cover of the Shining South sourcebook.''
document_data.title: The Shining South
document_data.author: [[Tom Prusa]]
document_data.released: April 1993<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dmsguild.com/product/16837/FR16-The-Shining-South-2e|title=FR16 The Shining South (2e)|author=Shannon Appelcline|accessdate=2015-06-28|publisher=Dungeon Masters Guild}}
document_data.mainbody:
'''''The Shining South''''' is a 2{{nd}}-edition ''Advanced Dungeons & Dragons'' accessory for the ''[[Forgotten Realms]]''.

{{Quote|''Far off in the south exist countries of legend. Here live the powerful, reclusive [[wizard|mage]]s of [[Halruaa]], the cheerful [[halfling]]s of [[Luiren]], and the traders of [[Durpar]] and [[Var]] the Golden. Come along on a risky visit to [[Dambrath]], a country ruled by an alliance of [[drow]] and the priestesses of [[Loviatar]], or to [[Ulgarth]], where the only true coffee in the Realms is grown.''

''Prepare to shop the fabulous markets of Durpar, break bread at the bakeries of Luiren, or see the horse fairs of Dambrath. The lucky among you might even catch a glimpse of a [[Halruaan Skyship|Halruan skyship]], floating through the skies above the [[Great Sea]], or witness the breathtaking, seemingly choreographed [[Dance of the Dolphins]].''

''This sourcebook contains the necessary gaming information for a FORGOTTEN REALMS campaign to expand into the countries collectively known as the [[Shining South]].''

''This accessory is suitable for use by all levels of play.''}}
document_data.Description:
''The Shining South'' is the 16{{th}} and final book in the [[FR series]]. It explores [[Halruaa]], [[Dambrath]], [[Luiren]], [[Durpar]], [[Var]], [[Estagund]], and [[Ulgarth]]. The book provides detailed descriptions of the geography of the Shining South, and the climate, terrain, and natural resources are all discussed

Each of the major regions in the Shining South has its own distinct cultures and societies. The accessory provides detailed descriptions of the people of these lands, their belief systems, social structures, and notable customs.

''The Shining South'' also introduces new monsters native to the region, many of which are tied to the magic and unique environments of the Shining South. In addition, new magical items and spells, many associated with Halruaa’s powerful wizards, are presented for use in campaigns. 

The supplement offers numerous adventure hooks and ideas for Dungeon Masters to incorporate into their campaigns.
document_data.Contents:
* Introduction
* Chapter 1: Halruaa
* Chapter 2: Dambrath
* Chapter 3: Luiren
* Chapter 4: Durpar, Var &Estagund
* Chapter 5: Ulgarth
* Chapter 6: Shining South Adventures
* Gateway to Elsewhere
* Dark as Dark
* New Monsters of the Shining South

Adventures.Gateway to Elsewhere:
{{Main|The Shining South (1993)/Gateway to Elsewhere}}
{{Quote|''An adventure for 5-8 player characters of levels 9-11, with a total of about 70-90 levels for the entire party. The adventure introduces characters to the [[Forest of Amtar]], near the country of [[Dambrath]].''}}
Adventures.Dark as Dark:
{{Main|The Shining South (1993)/Dark as Dark}}
{{Quote|''Dark as Dark is an adventure for 5-8 characters of levels 6-8. This adventure is set in the beast-lands of [[Veldorn]] in the nation of [[Ulgarth]]. Players will be dealing with [[undead]] creatures, including a [[vampire]]''.}}
